intro: Hieracium raphiolepium, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy, leafy stems and produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Hieracium raphiolepium is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, adapting well to dry conditions.
